data.title: To anybody that owns or knows anything about and Eico 147 Signal Tracer
data.text:
Kamchak Tuchuk

I've got one of these units that once belonged to my Grandfather. I don't have the test probes

though. Figure I need to fashion my own, if possible. Question is regarding the RF probe and also

the audio probe. What does the RF probe consist of? What kind of connector is this? BNC or

something? The audio probe apparently has two inputs so it seems theres more to it than just a

normal test probe. What would I need to do there? Thanks for any help.

Dale H. Cook

Post by Kamchak Tuchuk

I don't have the test probes

though. Figure I need to fashion my own, if possible.

They are probably the same as used with the 147A, and you can find

that manual online at:

http://bama.sbc.edu/eico.htm

Dale H. Cook, Chief Engineer, WWWR Roanoke VA, WCQV Moneta VA, WKBA WZZI Vinton VA, WKPA WLNI WZZU Lynchburg VA, WMNA / WMNA-FM Gretna VA

The Star City Pages - Antique Radios & Test Equipment, Engineering, Computers: http//members.cox.net/dalehcook/starcity.shtml
